page.title: 05ASLEEP IN THE 20th CENTURY 1
page.content: We went to Orton-on-the-hill on Monday for the first time and there were not many people about.The{attitudes}of the people we spoke to were very friendly. They called us'me darling'.Most of the houses had dogs who chased us.An old man asked us what we were doing and he was very interested.We were there from 10 o'clock until 12 o'clock and we only saw two cars and the butchers van .The old man got a big pile of bones for his dogs.He told us that it was not so long ago that he had to get his{water}from a pump in his garden.There are still no sewers in Orton.When you flush the toilet it goes into a tank under the ground called a cesspit.When it is full a man from the council comes round to empty it.We walked down the lane to Hollis { {Farm},looking at the{landscape}on either side.On one side was a water
